page.title: 16A new housing estate
page.content: Looking at the estate at the SE end of Hill Top Road, Conisbrough, we notice that there is a mixture of houses and bungalows. Some are semi-detached and some are in terraces of 3, 4 or 5. The houses are well spaced in rows; in cul-de-sacs; and around paved and landscaped areas. All the houses had their own back garden for which the occupants are responsible. But the front gardens are not fenced off and are tended by the local authority. Most residents do not like the open plan design because dogs and children trample over the flower beds and it seems less private and noisier.The streets are well lit, free from litter and have bus stops at regular intervals. Most people like the design of the houses but feel that they are a long way from the shops, churches and garages.
